package.name: MacOS Microsoft Word
package.releaseNotes: • Copilot: Draft with Copilot now supports more file references, larger file sizes and now allows you to write longer prompts in the prompt field. • Copilot: Fine tune text options from the Rewrite feature by telling Copilot how the output should change.

package.name: MacOS Microsoft Outlook
package.releaseNotes:
Feature Updates: • Calendar: Copilot users can easily catchup with meeting recordings, transcripts and notes from meeting popovers and details. • M365 Groups: We now allow dragging and dropping emails from M365 Groups to your desktop and generate .eml file. • Security: We now block screen sharing and taking screenshot for protected content.
Resolved Issues: • Calendar: Fixed an issue where moving an appointment event to another folder within the same account resulted in duplicate events appearing with an Exchange OnPremise account type. • Calendar: Fixed the issue where calendar reminders were being set to zero for delegates. • Mail: Fixed an issue that was causing the Outlook for Mac users to unable to add an account if the tenant have enforced CAE policies. • Mail: Fixed an issue where emails were not auto-saving when using nested compose and clicking away to another email. • Mail: Fixed the issue where replying to or forwarding an email that uses S/MIME caused the cursor to appear in the first line of the attributes section of the original message. • MyDay: Fixed an issue in My Day where users with multiple accounts in the same profile were unable to create events by dragging. Events will now be created in the correct account.

package.name: MacOS Microsoft OneNote
package.releaseNotes:
This month’s update is bug fixes only.
Thanks for using OneNote! We listened to your feedback and updated the application with optimizations to help improve your note taking experience.
Having trouble? Send feedback in the app by clicking on the smiley face in the top-right of the app. Have an idea? Add to our feature suggestion box at https://aka.ms/onenotefeedback

package.name: MacOS Microsoft OneDrive
package.releaseNotes: Thank you for using OneDrive. We are always looking to update OneDrive to bring you the latest performance improvements and bug fixes for the best experience.

package.name: MacOS Microsoft Windows App
package.releaseNotes:
In this release we made the following updates:
• Added new options to the Keyboard section of Preferences. • Cloud PC notifications are now stored and persist across app restarts. • Added notifications for cases where Cloud PC actions have failed. • Blocked the launch and import of RDP files for AVD-based connections. • Fixed a crash that occurred when removing the Sort toolbar button. • Resolved a bug preventing AVD Private Link connections from succeeding. • Only show supported device actions for Frontline Shared connections.
If you encounter any errors, you can contact us via Help > Submit Feedback.

package.name: MacOS Microsoft To-Do
package.releaseNotes: We fixed some bugs to improve the app experience.

package.name: MacOS Microsoft Azure VPN Client
package.releaseNotes: Added auto reconnect on VPN connections for intermittent/ server failures. Added notification which notifies user to install rosetta in case its not installed in arm machines. Minor bug fixes and performance improvements.
